title: Aberdeen backs call for BHP to quit lobby groups
text:
One of BHP's biggest shareholders has thrown its support behind a shareholder resolution calling for the miner to quit lobby groups whose advocacy contradicts the goals of the Paris climate agreement.

Aberdeen Standard Investments is the seventh biggest holder of BHP's London-listed shares with 2.47 per cent, plus a smaller holding of BHP's Australian stock.

Its backing suggests the resolutions filed by the Australasian Centre for Corporate Responsibility (ACCR) could garner more than the 10 per cent support given to similar resolutions at BHP's 2017 shareholder meetings.

Aberdeen spokesman Bill Hartnett did not clarify which lobby groups he was concerned about, but said BHP could do more.

“Failure to implement effective governance of its industry group lobbying activities serves to undermine the integrity of BHP’s climate leadership position and causes damage to its reputation,” he told Reuters.

The resolutions are largely aimed at the Minerals Council of Australia and Coal21.
description: One of BHP's biggest shareholders will back a shareholder resolution designed to drive BHP out of the Minerals Council.
